quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Snow and Man
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, iditarod, ground. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A three-legged dog walked into a saloon in the Old West. He sidled up to the bar and announced, “Im looking for the man ____________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: who shot my paw.”

questions.question: Who performed the song I Am a Rock, which contains the lines,
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Simon and Garfunkel

questions.question: What term refers to snow which partially melts upon reaching the ground and accumulates in puddles of partially frozen water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: slush

questions.question: Newsflash - All the toilets in New Yorks police stations have been stolen. As of now, it appears the police ___________ .

options.text: are all choked up with tears

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: have nothing to go on

questions.question: When cannibals ate a missionary, they got a ___________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: taste of religion

questions.question: What is the typical shape of snowflakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hexagon

questions.question: What singer first recorded the hit song Let It Snow! Let It Snow! Let It Snow!, which was written in Hollywood, California during one of the hottest days on record?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vaughn Monroe

questions.question: What animals pull the sleds in the Iditarod  Trail Sled Race, which is held annually in Alaska?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dogs

questions.question: What English singer-songwriter recorded the album 50 Words for Snow, which consists of seven songs set against a backdrop of falling snow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kate Bush

questions.question: A man needs a mistress just to break the __________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: monogamy

questions.question: On what other planet of the Solar System have scientist observed a phenomenon similar to snow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Venus

questions.question: What color is the snow flower, also known as Sarcodes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: red

questions.question: The town of Kemi, which in 1996 became the home of the worlds largest snow castle, is located in this European country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Finland

questions.question: In democracy its your vote that counts. In feudalism its your ______________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: count that votes

questions.question: What nationality is author Orhan Pamuk who won the 2006 Nobel Prize in Literature for his novel Snow?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Turkish

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Creation and Arrow
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, arrow, inspector. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A boiled egg in the morning is __________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: hard to beat

questions.question: Inspector Jules Maigret featured in over seventy crime novels by this Belgian writer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Georges Simenon

questions.question: Time flies like an arrow. Fruit flies like a _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: banana

questions.question: The man who survived mustard gas and pepper spray is now a ____________
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: seasoned veteran

questions.question: Swiss dramatist and author Friedrich Dürrenmatt  wrote two mystery novels featuring this Inspector of Police in Bern.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Inspector Barlach

questions.question: Two hats were hanging on a hat rack in the hallway. One hat said to the other, “You stay here, _________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ill go on a head

questions.question: I stayed up all night to see where the sun went, and then it _______.

options.text: popped out of nowhere and blew my mind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: dawned on me

questions.question: Detective Erlendur, based in Rekjavik, is the creation of this widely translated and award-winning crime novelist
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnaldur Indridason

questions.question: Two silk worms had a race. They ended up __________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: in a tie

questions.question: Atheism is a _______ organization.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: non-prophet

questions.question: Inspector Konrad Sejer is the creation of this poet and novelist who has been described as the Norwegian Queen of Crime.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Karin Fossum

questions.question: This Swedish detective was the creation of the husband and wife writing team of Per Wahloo and Maj Sjowal.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Beck

questions.question: Which of these is a California smog test?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Can UCLA?

questions.question: Detective Kurt Wallender, based in Ystad in south Sweden, is the creation of this prolific writer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henning Mankell

questions.question: England has no kidney bank, but it does have a ___________
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liverpool

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Road and Chicken
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, whiskey, boris. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: A sign on the lawn at a drug rehab center said: “Keep off the ______ .”
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grass

questions.question: Arthur Godfreys Talent Scouts started in 1948 and ended in 1958. There were 2 famous performers that were turned down after auditioning and never made the show. Who were they?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elvis Presley and Buddy Holly

questions.question: Which of the following statements about French crime novelist Fred Vargas is true?

options.text: Fred Vargas is the pen-name of the (female) historian Frédérique Audoin-Rouzeau.
The character Commissaire Jean-Baptiste Adamsberg appears in several of Vargas novels.
Vargas has had a successful career as an archaeologist.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All these

questions.question: Salvo Montalbano, created by Andrea Camilleri, is an Italian police inspector based here.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sicily

questions.question: Amy wants to measure 100ml of water, but she only has two measuring cups. The first measuring cup can hold 200ml and the second can hold 300ml.  Can Amy achieve her goal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The fattest knight at King Arthurs Round Table was Sir Cumference. He acquired his size from too much _____ .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: pi

questions.question: A chicken crossing the road is ______ in motion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: poultry

questions.question: A dog gave birth to puppies near the road and was cited for ___________ .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: littering

questions.question: I fired my masseuse today. She just ________ me the wrong way.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: rubbed

questions.question: A girl phoned me and said, “Come on over, theres nobody home.” I went over. Pick the next sentence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nobody was home.

questions.question: I wondered why the baseball kept getting bigger. Add the next 4-word sentence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Then it hit me.

questions.question: Which of the following European Author - Investigator pairings is not correct?

options.text: Petros Markaris and Inspector Costas Haritos
Manuel Vázquez Montalbán and Pepe Carvalho

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stieg Larsson and Harry Hole

questions.question: A hole has been found in the nudist camp wall. The police are _____    ______    _______.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: looking into it

questions.question: Boris Akunins first work to appear in English was a series of historical mysteries set in late 19th century Imperial Russia. Who was the protagonist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erast Petrovich Fandorin

questions.question: She was only a whiskey maker, but he loved her ________ .
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: still

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Soap and Characters
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This soap operas original title included the words the need but in 2001 it dropped those words and is called by one name only. Cast characters include: Owen Meyer, Judy Ditchfield, Jo da Silva and, Bianca Amato. What country produced this soap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: I Hope Youre The One is the title of this soap that ran from 2001-2003. The characters were Frances Peron, Raul Gaston, Don Ramon Altamonte and Amadeus. Which country produced it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philippines

questions.question: Good Times, Bad Times is the translation of this soap that has the following characters: Lucas Sanders, Mike Brandt, Lorena Gonzalez and, Nuran Baydar. What country owns it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Netherlands

questions.question: The soap opera Workout is mainly for teenagers and it first aired in 1995. It was originally set in the Workout Gym, then the setting changed to Middle Choice High School. Characters include Bernardo Oliveira, Nanda, Manuela and, Marcelo. What country gave us this soap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brazil

questions.question: This actor is best known for the TV shows Golden Goose Cafe, Silver Swan Cafe, The Human Joke Machine.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morey Amsterdam

questions.question: This show was vaudevillian in nature and featured Wally Cox, Arnold Stang and, Buddy Hackett. It only lasted from January to April 1949 and only one episode of the show has survived.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The School House

questions.question: This show was nominated for an Emmy in 1950 for Best Film made for TV along with The Lone Ranger and the winner The Life of Riley (with Jackie Gleason). Some of the guest stars during its 38-episode run were: Burgess Meredith, Eva Gabor, Henry Morgan, George Reeves, William Frawley, Ward Bond, Don DeFore, and Hugh Beaumont. Can you name the show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Silver Theater

questions.question: This musical show lasted from March to September 1949 and was hosted by a Latin musician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flight to Rhythm

questions.question: On which show  can you find the following characters: Peggy the Penguin, Honey the Bunny, Mr. Mischief the Panda, and Trina the Kitten?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Small Fry Club

questions.question: Which of the following TV shows debuted in the 1950s?

options.text: Beat the Clock - Burns and Allen
The Fred Waring Show - The Front Page
Mama (AKA I Remember Mama) - Milton Berle Show (AKA Texaco Star Theater)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beat the Clock - Burns and Allen

questions.question: This soap claimed to be the answer to the popular American soap Melrose Place. Its characters included Angela Kostapas, Bronwyn Kellett, Gideon Miller and Wiki Taylor. In what country was it produced?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Zealand

questions.question: The translation of this soaps title is Tiny Angels and 4 of the characters are; Marcela Ferradas, Lidia Catalano, Adriana Salonia and, Mariana Briski. Which country had this soap?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Argentina

questions.question: The characters had lightning bolts sewn on their uniforms and a robot was first used on TV in this series.

options.text: Captain Video and His Video Rangers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Captain Video and His Video Rangers

questions.question: Cheerio, Id better be... shoveling off; Business is a little dead tonight were phrases uttered by the the friendly undertaker on what show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Life of Riley

questions.question: This show has been called The Eyes Have It (1948), Stop, Look, and Listen (1948) and also, Riddle Me This (1948-1949).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Celebrity Time

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Country and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This Irish-born author published her first novel Under the Net in 1954. She was portrayed by Kate Winslet and Judi Dench in a 2001 movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iris Murdoch

questions.question: This singer-songwriter and musician, known as the Belfast Cowboy, recorded the studio albums Astral Weeks and Moondance and the live album Its Too Late to Stop Now.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Van Morrison

questions.question: This Irish playwright and a co-founder of the London School of Economics wrote more than 60 plays during his lifetime, which earned him a Nobel Prize in Literature in 1925.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: This Irish actor and environmentalist is famous for his recurring role as British spy James Bond.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pierce Brosnan

questions.question: Hotel Caesar has been around since 1998 and past characters on the show have been: Ragnar Lunde, Rolv Espevoll, Thomas Hildring and, Bob Affe. Which country owns it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norway

questions.question: What Irish actor rose to stardom in 1962 when he played T. E. Lawrence in Lawrence of Arabia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter OToole

questions.question: This poet and playwright was the first Irishman honored with the Nobel Prize in Literature. In his later years he served as an Irish Senator for two terms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Butler Yeats

questions.question: This Irish modernist author wrote a landmark novel which parallels episodes of Homers Odyssey.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Joyce

questions.question: This red-headed Irish actress often worked with director John Ford and her longtime friend John Wayne. Her autobiography, Tis Herself, was published in 2004 and became a New York Times Bestseller.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maureen OHara

questions.question: This Irish actor has played a German industrialist, credited with saving over 1,100 Jews, a Jedi master and an Irish revolutionary.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liam Neeson

questions.question: What military conflict is depicted in Stephen Cranes novel The Red Badge of Courage?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the American Civil War

questions.question: The soap opera Õnne 13 was originally aired in 1993. Characters include Mare Peterson, Alma Saarepera, Kristan Rosenkampf-Jägerfreund and, Jaanus Peterson. Which country claims it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Estonia

questions.question: A Useless Person is is the English translation of this soap operas title. Characters include Mirando Zapata (the actor who played him won 2 awards), Francisco Martínez, Gabo Gaviria and, Liliana. Can you name the country that produced it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia

questions.question: This Irish singer-songwriter rose to fame with her debut album The Lion and the Cobra. In 1992, she infamously tore a photo into pieces, saying Fight the real enemy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sinead OConnor

questions.question: The title of this soap opera translates as The Taste of Life and is the first soap opera in this country.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cambodia

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Novel and School
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, pioneer, semester. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The plot and the interactions of the characters in Leo Tolstoys novel War and Peace take place in the era surrounding this historical event.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the 1812 French invasion of Russia

questions.question: An important event described in the novel Captain Corellis Mandolin is the massacre of Italian troops by the Germans in September 1943. On what island did the massacre occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cephallonia

questions.question: Which of the following novels is subtitled A Narrative of the Time of Nero?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quo Vadis

questions.question: In the novel The Three Musketeers, which Queen consort of France secretly conducts an affair with the Duke of Buckingham?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne of Austria

questions.question: What novel by Charles Dickens is set before and during the French Revolution?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Tale of Two Cities

questions.question: This pioneer of the Beat generation earned a scholarship for Columbia University due to his athletic skills as a running back in American football. After cracking a tibia his football career was over and he dropped out of university.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Kerouac

questions.question: This author, who won the Nobel Prize for Literature and the Pulitzer Prize for his novel The Reivers, dropped out of school at age 15 to work in his grandfather’s bank.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Faulkner

questions.question: This Victorian writer left school to work in a boot blacking factory after his father was thrown into debtors prison.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: Which novel of James Clavels popular Asian Saga opens in 1945 and focuses on prisoners of war in a Japanese camp in Singapore?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Rat

questions.question: Alison Weirs novel Innocent Traitor tells the story of an English noblewoman, known as the The Nine Days Queen. What was her name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Jane Grey

questions.question: This notable author dropped out of school at the age of 12, when his father died. He became a printers apprentice and later worked as a steamboat pilot, an occupation that gave him his pen name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mark Twain

questions.question: This Irish playwright, who was awarded a Nobel Prize in Literature and an Oscar, harboured a lifelong animosity toward schools and teachers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Bernard Shaw

questions.question: What famous French novel depicts the notorious St. Bartholomews Day Massacre of 1572, when thousands of Protestants are slaughtered?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Queen Margot

questions.question: This Pulitzer-Prize-winning author studied law but dropped out after the first semester. Like the narrator of her only novel, she was the daughter of a respected small-town attorney.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harper Lee

questions.question: What novel by Kurt Vonnegut is based on real life World War II events, written from the perspective of characters?

options.text: Breakfast of Champions, or Goodbye Blue Monday

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Slaughterhouse-Five
